required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Annexin Imaging in Dissection of the Descending Aorta
clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic of Annexin Imaging in Dissection of the Descending Aorta

brief_summary.textblock: The relationship between the presence of a partial thrombus and aortic dilation after type B dissection has recently been reported. The originality lies in the idea of imaging thrombus activity to predict dilation after type B dissection. The innovative character is based on the use of annexin scintigraphy.

detailed_description.textblock: To establish the proof of concept in humans of the link between the intensity of 99mTc-annexin V-128 binding in the descending thoracic aorta and the progression of aortic diameter in patients with type B aortic dissection.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between the rate of expansion of the aortic diameter and the intensity of attachment of the annexin by the aortic wall descending
primary_outcome.description: Pearson correlation coefficient between the rate of expansion of the aortic diameter measured by CT (at 6 months, 18 months and 30 months) in mm/year (at the site of maximum expansion) and the intensity of attachment of the annexin by the aortic wall descending in scintigraphy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of the optimal threshold for annexin fixation to predict the evolution of aortic dilation (< 2 mm/year, >=2mm year) using ROC curve.
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of the optimal threshold for annexin fixation to predict the evolution of aortic dilation (< 2 mm/year, >=2mm year) using ROC curve. The cut-off point will be defined by the Youden index.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood level of fibrinolysis markers (D dimers, plasmin/anti-plasmin complexes)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood level of fibrinolysis markers (D dimers, plasmin/anti-plasmin complexes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood level of thrombus procoagulant activity markers (circulating P-selectin and thrombin/anti-thrombin complexes)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood level of thrombus procoagulant activity markers (circulating P-selectin and thrombin/anti-thrombin complexes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Morphological characteristics of the wall thrombus
secondary_outcome.description: Morphological characteristics of the wall thrombus: no thrombus of the false lumen, partial thrombosis or total thrombosis of the false lumen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of potential predictive clinical factors of aortic dilation rate
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of potential predictive clinical factors of aortic dilation rate: age, blood pressure, heart rate, sex, history of dissection, etiology (Marfan or no Marfan)

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of potential predictive SPECT factors of aortic dilation rate
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of potential predictive SPECT factors of aortic dilation rate: anormal annexin binding, ratio of annexin binding (TBR = Target-to-Background Ratio)

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of potential predictive biological factors of aortic dilation rate
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of potential predictive biological factors (C-Reactive Protein) of aortic dilation rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of potential predictive morphological factors of aortic dilation rate
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of potential predictive morphological factors of aortic dilation rate: no thrombus, partial thrombosis or total thrombosis.
Number of cardiovascular events: cardiovascular death, dissection complications (including aortic rupture, malperfusion, emboli), aortic surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the tolerance of the annexin scintigraphy by collecting side effects occurence
secondary_outcome.description: Tolerance of the annexin scintigraphy will be assessed using a questionnaire during a phone call at day 3 to ask the patients about side effects occurrence.

arm_group.description: All patients will undergo a 99mTc-annexin V-128 scintigraphy (SPECT)

intervention.description: All patients will undergo a 99mTc-annexin V-128 scintigraphy (SPECT)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient whose age is ≥ 18 years old
- any patient seen more than 6 months and less than 5 years after a dissection involving the descending aorta at Bichat Hospital, whether it is a dissection of the descending aorta alone or a dissection of the ascending aorta extended to the descending aorta
- dissection of the uncomplicated descending thoracic aorta: not requiring surgery or stent implantation within the first 6 months after acute dissection
- effective contraception for women of childbearing age
Exclusion Criteria:
- scheduled procedure for dissection of the descending aorta
- contraindication to aortic CT with injection of contrast media: renal failure with creatinine clearance <30 ml/min or creatinine >200 µmol/l; allergy to contrast media
- history of surgery or stent implantation in the descending thoracic aorta
- pregnant or breastfeeding women
- patient under guardianship or trusteeship
- non affiliation to social security or CMU (beneficiary or assignee)
- patient refusal to participate in the study

facility.name: Service de Cardiologie - Hôpital Bichat Claude Bernard
